channel.title: npc texture drawing fail - win 7 x64
channel.description:
Specific objects appear to lack textures wrapped around the models. escalators and scientists on the Title/ main menu screen show as glowing "colors" [usually white], while most objects render properly. (Screenshot Imgur album here ==> [url]https://imgur.com/a/rRw8K/[/url] ).
Due to Dual Graphic card setup, Game configured to force graphics processing from Nvidia GeForce GTX 660M. attempts to use "-dxlevel ##" [##'s attempted = 90,95,98] caused game to register different directx versions yet yielded no results in altered performance, better nor worse. update drivers for integrated Intel and Nvidia card provided no effect, neither positive or negative.
problems existed constant with occasional proper rendering of face's and hands [as seen in linked image album]. problem persisted beyond first, second and third level load points along tram path. problem continued throughout lab in acquisition of "hazard suit". game session ended by author, at this point, and save file discarded.
System specs via Speccy Summary Operating System MS Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit SP1 CPU Intel Core i7 @ 2.30GHz 52 °C Ivy Bridge 22nm Technology RAM 6.00 GB Dual-Channel DDR3 @ 798MHz (11-11-11-28) Motherboard LENOVO Product Name (U3E1) 51 °C Graphics Generic PnP Monitor (1366x768@60Hz) NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660M Intel(R) HD Graphics 4000 Hard Drives 699GB Seagate ST750LM022 HN-M750MBB (SATA) Optical Drives PLDS DVD-RW DS8A8SH Audio Realtek High Definition Audio Operating System MS Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit SP1 Computer type: Notebook Installation Date: 08 September 2012, 07:01
CPU Intel Core i7 Cores 4 Threads 8 Name Intel Core i7 Code Name Ivy Bridge Package Socket 988B rPGA Technology 22nm Specification Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-3610QM CPU @ 2.30GHz Family 6 Extended Family 6 Model A Extended Model 3A Stepping 9 Revision E1 Instructions MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, SSSE3, SSE4.1, SSE4.2, Intel 64 Virtualization Supported, Disabled Hyperthreading Supported, Enabled Bus Speed 99.8 MHz Stock Core Speed 2300 MHz Stock Bus Speed 100 MHz
RAM Memory slots Total memory slots 2 Used memory slots 2 Free memory slots 0 Memory Type DDR3 Size 6144 MBytes Channels # Dual DRAM Frequency 798.3 MHz CAS# Latency (CL) 11 clocks RAS# to CAS# Delay (tRCD) 11 clocks RAS# Precharge (tRP) 11 clocks Cycle Time (tRAS) 28 clocks Command Rate (CR) 1T Physical Memory Memory Usage 40 % Total Physical 5.90 GB Available Physical 3.49 GB Total Virtual 12 GB Available Virtual 8.95 GB
Motherboard Manufacturer LENOVO Model Product Name (U3E1) Version Lenovo IdeaPad Y580 Chipset Vendor Intel Chipset Model Ivy Bridge Chipset Revision 09 Southbridge Vendor Intel Southbridge Model ID1E59 Southbridge Revision 04 System Temperature 51 °C BIOS Brand LENOVO Version 5DCN37WW(V2.04) Date 06/05/2012
Graphics Monitor Name Generic PnP Monitor on Intel HD Graphics 4000 Current Resolution 1366x768 pixels Work Resolution 1366x728 pixels State enabled, primary Monitor Width 1366 Monitor Height 768 Monitor BPP 32 bits per pixel Monitor Frequency 60 Hz Device \\.\DISPLAY1\Monitor0 NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660M Memory 4294965248 MB Memory type 2 Driver version 9.18.13.623 Intel(R) HD Graphics 4000 Memory 4294965312 MB Memory type 2 Driver version 8.15.10.2761 OpenGL Version 3.3.0 - Build 8.15.10.2761 Vendor Intel Renderer Intel(R) HD Graphics 4000 GLU Version 1.2.2.0 Microsoft Corporation
Hard Drives ST750LM022 HN-M750MBB Manufacturer Seagate Form Factor 1.8" Heads 16 Cylinders 16383 SATA type SATA-II 3.0Gb/s Device type Fixed ATA Standard ATA8-ACS Serial Number S2USJ9AC604399 LBA Size 48-bit LBA Power On Count 64 times Power On Time 8.4 days Speed, Expressed in Revolutions Per Minute (rpm) 5400 Features S.M.A.R.T., APM, NCQ Transfer Mode SATA II Interface SATA Capacity 699GB Real size 750,156,374,016 bytes
Audio Sound Cards Realtek High Definition Audio Intel(R) Display Audio Bluetooth Hands-free Audio Playback Devices Realtek Digital Output (Realtek High Definition Audio) Speakers (Realtek High Definition Audio) (default) Recording Devices Microphone (Realtek High Definition Audio) (default) Stereo Mix (Realtek High Definition Audio) Speaker Configuration Speaker type Stereo
------------------------------------------------------------- Final notes:
Game only runs under "compatibility mode" with operating system selection from "win xp service pack 3" to "windows 7" allowing function. not running under compatibility mode causes game to fail after "blurred menu Loading screen" with text "hl2.exe has stopped working" dialog.

item.title: npc texture drawing fail - win 7 x64
item.dc:creator: mykosyko
item.description:
I had a similar problem. I found that playing in online mode fixes it, but the problem appears again when I am playing in offline mode. In addition to this, in offline mode the savegame menu images don’t appear properly.

Operating System
Microsoft Windows 7 Professional 64-bit
CPU
Intel Core i7 @ 2.10GHz 50 °C
Ivy Bridge 22nm Technology
RAM
8.00 GB Dual-Channel DDR3 @ 798MHz (11-11-11-28)
Motherboard
LENOVO 3259CTO (CPU Socket - U3E1) 30 °C
Graphics
Generic PnP Monitor (1600x900@50Hz)
Intel HD Graphics 4000
NVIDIA GeForce GT 630M
Hard Drives
932GB Western Digital WDC WD10JPVT-08A1YT1 ATA Device (SATA) 43 °C
14.9GB SDHC Card (NULL)
Optical Drives
HL-DT-ST DVDRAM GT50N ATA Device
DTSOFT Virtual CdRom Device
Audio
Conexant 20671 SmartAudio HD

Read full topic
item.source: npc texture drawing fail - win 7 x64

item.title: npc texture drawing fail - win 7 x64
item.dc:creator: Anarchic_Harmony
item.description:
Specific objects appear to lack textures wrapped around the models. escalators and scientists on the Title/ main menu screen show as glowing “colors” [usually white], while most objects render properly. (Screenshot Imgur album here ==> https://imgur.com/a/rRw8K/ ).

Due to Dual Graphic card setup, Game configured to force graphics processing from Nvidia GeForce GTX 660M. attempts to use “-dxlevel ##” [##'s attempted = 90,95,98] caused game to register different directx versions yet yielded no results in altered performance, better nor worse. update drivers for integrated Intel and Nvidia card provided no effect, neither positive or negative.

problems existed constant with occasional proper rendering of face’s and hands [as seen in linked image album]. problem persisted beyond first, second and third level load points along tram path. problem continued throughout lab in acquisition of “hazard suit”. game session ended by author, at this point, and save file discarded.
